conformanceStatements.description: The value of 1[1] SHALL be equal to 1.
The value of 30[1] SHALL be equal to Y.

fields.name: Set ID - PID
fields.comment: A number which identifies the occurrence of the PID segment within the transaction.

fields.name: Patient Identifier List
fields.comment:
Field used to convey all types of patient/person identifiers.   It is expected that Social Security Number will be provided if it is available.  The value “99999999” should be used for persons who do not have a social security number. 
Also used to support identifiers for the death certificate.

fields.name: Patient Name
fields.comment: Patient name.  When the name of the patient is not known, a value must still be placed in this field since the field is required.  In that case, HL7 recommends the following: |~^^^^^^U|.  The "U" for the name type code in the second name indicates that it is unspecified.  Since there may be no name components populated, this means there is no legal name, nor is there an alias.  This guide will interpret this sequence to mean there is no patient name.

fields.name: Date/Time of Birth
fields.comment:
Patient’s date of birth.  
If the birth information is not known, leave the field empty.

fields.name: Administrative Sex
fields.comment: Patient’s sex.

fields.name: Patient Alias
fields.comment: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.4.  See PID-5 Patient Name.

fields.name: Race
fields.comment: Race information for the decedent.

fields.name: Patient Address
fields.comment: Street address, city, state and zip code are expected

fields.name: County Code
fields.comment: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.3.  See PID-11 - Patient Address, component 9 County/Parish Code

fields.name: SSN Number - Patient
fields.comment: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.3.1.  See PID-3 Patient Identifier List.

fields.name: Driver's License Number - Patient
fields.comment: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.5.  See PID-3 Patient Identifier List.

fields.name: Nationality
fields.comment: Deprecated as of HL7 Version 2.4.  See PID-10 Race, PID-22 Ethnic Group, and PID-26 Citizenship

fields.name: Patient Death Date and Time
fields.comment: Business Rule: At least a year must be provided, even if the date is not known with certainty.

fields.name: Patient Death Indicator
fields.comment: The patient is known to be dead.

fields.name: Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Title
Next of Kin / Associated Parties Job Code/Class
Next of Kin / Associated Parties Employee Number
Software Certified Version or Release Number

predicates.description: If the value of 9[1] is not equal to Y.
If the value of 9[1] is not equal to Y.
If the value of 6[1] is equal to Y.
If the value of 6[1] is equal to Y.

fields.name: Death Location
fields.comment: This field is valued with the place the death occurred

fields.name: Death Certificate Signed Date/Time
fields.comment:
This field is valued with the date and time the death certificate was signed.
Must be valued if the case/death has been assigned to the coroner/medical examiner for investigative purposes

fields.name: Death Certified By
fields.comment:
This field is valued with the person who signed the death certificate.  The full name of the certifier is required. 
The professional status of the certifier – the “Certifier Title” is recorded as the professional name prefix within the XCN data type.

fields.name: Autopsy Indicator
fields.comment: This field indicates whether an autopsy was performed

fields.name: Autopsy Start and End Date/Time
fields.comment: If an autopsy is performed, this field is valued with the date and time the autopsy was begun and completed.

fields.name: Autopsy Performed By
fields.comment: This field is valued with the authority who performed the autopsy

fields.name: Coroner Indicator
fields.comment: This flag indicates whether the case/death has been assigned to the coroner/medical examiner for investigative purposes

conformanceStatements.description: The value of 2[1] SHALL be equal to N.

fields.name: Patient Class
fields.comment: Patient class information is not relevant for this   Implementation Guide.

fields.name: Relationship to the Patient Start Date
Relationship to the Patient Stop Date
Insured Employer Organization Name and ID

conformanceStatements.description: The value of 7[1] SHALL be valid in format: 'YYYYMMDDhhmmss.sss+-ZZZZ'.

fields.name: Field Separator
fields.comment:
Character to be used as the field separator for the rest of the message.
Conformance Statement: MSH-1 (Field Separator) SHALL contain the constant value ‘|’.

fields.name: Encoding Characters
fields.comment:
Four characters, always appearing in the same order: |^~\&|.
Conformance Statement: MSH-2 (Encoding Characters) SHALL contain the constant value ‘^~\&

fields.name: Sending Application
fields.comment:
Field is used to identify the sending application uniquely for messaging purposes.  
Example: |StateAppID |

fields.name: Sending Facility
fields.comment: Field that uniquely identifies the facility that sends the message.  This identifies the originator of the original message.  If acknowledgments are in use, this facility will receive any related acknowledgment message

fields.name: Receiving Application
fields.comment:
Field is used to identify the receiving application uniquely for messaging purposes.  
Example: |Lab1 |

fields.name: Receiving Facility
fields.comment: Field that uniquely identifies the facility that is to receive the message.  This identifies the receiver of the original message.  If acknowledgments are in use, this facility originates any related acknowledgment message.

fields.name: Date/Time of Message
fields.comment:
Field containing the date/time the message was created by the sending system.  
Note that the time zone offset is required, and the minimum granularity is to the second, although more precise time stamps are allowed.
The time zone that is specified should be considered as the default for other date/times within the message.

fields.name: Security
fields.comment: This field can be used to implement security features.

fields.name: Message Type
fields.comment: For the death report messages, the value will vary.  It will indicate the trigger event and the abstract message type.

fields.name: Message Control ID
fields.comment: String that uniquely identifies the message instance from the sending application.  Example formats for message control IDs include GUID, timestamp plus sequence number, OID plus sequence number or sequence number.  The important point is that care must be taken to insure that the message control id is unique.  The sending application (MSH-3) plus MSH-10 (message control id) needs to be globally unique.

fields.name: Processing ID
fields.comment: Field is used to indicate the intent for processing the message, such as "T" (training,) "D" (debug,) or "P" (production.)

fields.name: Version ID
fields.comment: HL7 version number used to interpret format and content of the message.  For this message, the version ID will always be Literal Value: 2.6.

fields.name: Country Code
fields.comment: The expected value is ’USA’, and may be assumed if no value is passed in the field.

fields.name: Message Profile Identifier
fields.comment: The field is used, to indicate a particular set of fields as supported within the context of a particular jurisdiction.

fields.name: Patient Primary Care Provider Name & ID No.
Event Type Code
fields.comment: Not supported, since the needed content is carried in MSH.9.

predicates.description: If the value of 3[1].1[1] is equal to 39016-1.

fields.name: Set ID - OBX
fields.comment: For the first instance of the OBX segment, the sequence number shall be one (1), for the second instance, the sequence number shall be two (2), etc.

fields.name: Value Type
fields.comment: This field identifies the data type used for OBX.5.

fields.name: Observation Identifier
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the type of observation. This field provides a code for the type of observation.  See this list of observation identifiers in the next section of this document.

fields.name: Observation Sub-ID
fields.comment:
The element is used to identify the sequence of death causes, and to link death cause with the time interval between death and onset of the causal condition.
On a provider supplied report the immediate cause of death is listed as 1.  Causes leading to the immediate cause are listed sequentially in order to show the chain of events that led directly and inevitably to death.  The underlying cause of death – the disease or injury that initiated the chain of events – is given the highest valued sub-id.
On a coded cause of death report, each cause of death code is associated with the line and sequence within line that it was drawn from.  It is also associated with indicators for eCodes as well as error flags.  [See the Cause of Death Observations Section that provides an example of OBX.4 in use.]

fields.name: Observation Value
fields.comment: The content of the observation.  The data type will vary depending on observation ID.

fields.name: Units
fields.comment: UCUM® is an HL7-approved code system and shall be used for units of measure where needed
